Package controlPanel

Class ScheduleUpdateView

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
controlPanel.AbstractView
controlPanel.AbstractGenericView
controlPanel.ScheduleUpdateView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ScheduleUpdateView
extends AbstractGenericView
Schedule Create View allows users to select an existing billboard and create or update the schedule. Users can set the start and end time, days scheduled and the recurrence setting (I.e. minutes, hourly, no repetition). Users can also clear the existing schedule.
See Also:
Serialized Form

      Upon submitting Schedule, ensure user has selected a BB name
      Returns:
      true if BB has been selected, false if no BB has been selected

    • checkValidDuration

      protected boolean checkValidDuration()
      Upon submitting schedule, check that the duration is bigger than 0
      Returns:
      true if valid duration, false if invalid duration

      protected int showScheduleClearConfirmation()
      Upon attempting to clear schedule, ask user to confirm schedule removal
      Returns:
      return result of user selection, 0 = confirm, other values are for cancel or exit

    • showScheduleErrorMessage

      protected void showScheduleErrorMessage()
      Show schedule error message to the user

    • setScheduleValues

      protected void setScheduleValues​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> selectedDays, int startHour, int startMin, int BBduration, java.lang.String buttonSelected, int minRepeat, java.lang.String AMPMtag)
      Set values from the server on the GUI. These values include: the selected days, start hour, start min, duration, button selected, minute repetition
      Parameters:
      selectedDays - boolean array of selected days - if selected = true, not selected = false
      startHour - starting hour as an int
      startMin - starting minute as an int
      BBduration - duration of schedule as an int
      buttonSelected - button selected as a string (i.e. "hourly", "minute", "no repeats")
      minRepeat - number of minutes for minute repeat
      AMPMtag - am pm tag as a string (i.e. "AM", "PM")

    • setMinuteLabel

      protected void setMinuteLabel​(int minuteRepeat)
      Set Minute Label to reflect the number of hours and minutes the bb will be repeated
      Parameters:
      minuteRepeat - number of minutes the bb will be shown

    • setBBNamesFromDB

      protected void setBBNamesFromDB​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> BBNames)
      Add BB Names to the ComboBox Selector such that users are able to select their Billboard to schedule.
      Parameters:
      BBNames - string array of all billboard names

    • enableMinuteSelector

      protected void enableMinuteSelector​(boolean enable)
      Enable or Disable Minute Selector
      Parameters:
      enable - boolean value whereby false = disable and true = enable

    • calcDuration

      protected void calcDuration()
      Calculate the Billboard duration based on the start and end time selected. Inform user when invalid time is selected. Set Duration Time Label and disable specific radio buttons depending on the duration (i.e. duration less than 1 hour, disable hourly radio button). Set List of valid minutes in minute combobox.

    • getScheduleInfo

      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> getScheduleInfo()
      Upon successfully submitting Schedule, get the schedule information from the user inputs and return an Object type Array list.
      Returns:
      schedule info array

    • getSelectedBBName

      protected java.lang.String getSelectedBBName()
      Get selected BB name
      Returns:
      selected bb name as a string

    • getMinuteRepeat

      protected int getMinuteRepeat() throws java.lang.Exception
      Get the number of minutes the bb will be repeatedly scheduled.
      Returns:
      return minute value selected
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - minutes not set exception

      protected void addScheduleTimeListener​(java.awt.event.ItemListener listener)
      Add item listener to schedule time selectors
      Parameters:
